about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: It is unlawful to:
hasPart.assesses: It is unlawful to: | It is unlawful to: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal to cross the centerline to pass when driving on hills, in curves, and in other locations where you cannot see ahead far enough to pass safely. You may not pass at street crossings, at railroad crossings, where signs indicate no passing zones, or where a solid yellow line is next to your lane. You may not pass when the vehicle in front of you has stopped for a pedestrian or when driving in work zones where passing would be hazardous.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pass another vehicle in any marked no passing zone.

comment.text: Pass another vehicle in any marked no passing zone.

suggestedAnswer.text: Pass another vehicle over a railroad crossing.

comment.text: Pass another vehicle over a railroad crossing.
Both of the above.
Both of the above.

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal to cross the centerline to pass when driving on hills, in curves, and in other locations where you cannot see ahead far enough to pass safely. You may not pass at street crossings, at railroad crossings, where signs indicate no passing zones, or where a solid yellow line is next to your lane. You may not pass when the vehicle in front of you has stopped for a pedestrian or when driving in work zones where passing would be hazardous.

comment.text: It is unlawful to: | It is illegal to cross the centerline to pass when driving on hills, in curves, and in other locations where you cannot see ahead far enough to pass safely. You may not pass at street crossings, at railroad crossings, where signs indicate no passing zones, or where a solid yellow line is next to your lane. You may not pass when the vehicle in front of you has stopped for a pedestrian or when driving in work zones where passing would be hazardous.

hasPart.name: While all of the following actions are dangerous to do while driving, which is also illegal?

about.name: While all of the following actions are dangerous to do while driving, which is also illegal?

hasPart.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones is dangerous and illegal.

suggestedAnswer.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones.

comment.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones.
Adjusting your outside mirrors.
Reading a road map.

acceptedAnswer.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones.

comment.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones.

answerExplanation.text: Listening to music through a set of dual headphones is dangerous and illegal.

hasPart.name: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes?

about.name: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes? | Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Driving above the speed limit, driving too far below the speed limit, and driving too fast for conditions are all actions that commonly contribute to traffic accidents. Always drive with the general flow of traffic, within legal speed limits.

suggestedAnswer.text: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.

comment.text: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.

suggestedAnswer.text: Getting adequate rest and staying alert.

comment.text: Getting adequate rest and staying alert.

suggestedAnswer.text: Scanning the environment and staying focused on the driving task.

comment.text: Scanning the environment and staying focused on the driving task.

acceptedAnswer.text: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.

comment.text: Exceeding the posted speed limit and driving too fast for conditions or circumstances.

answerExplanation.text: Driving above the speed limit, driving too far below the speed limit, and driving too fast for conditions are all actions that commonly contribute to traffic accidents. Always drive with the general flow of traffic, within legal speed limits.

comment.text: Which of the following are factors commonly contributing to traffic crashes? | Driving above the speed limit, driving too far below the speed limit, and driving too fast for conditions are all actions that commonly contribute to traffic accidents. Always drive with the general flow of traffic, within legal speed limits.

hasPart.name: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:

about.name: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should: | If there is a deep puddle on the road ahead, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.

comment.text: Maintain the posted speed to make it through the water.
Avoid the puddle if possible.

suggestedAnswer.text: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.

comment.text: Shift into neutral as you drive through the water.
Avoid the puddle if possible.

answerExplanation.text: To prevent skidding on slippery surfaces, avoid especially slippery areas, such as ice patches, wet leaves, oil, or deep puddles. The safest surface for driving is a dry, solid surface.

about.name: This red and white sign means you should:

hasPart.assesses: This red and white sign means you should: | This red and white sign means you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.

comment.text: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.

suggestedAnswer.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

comment.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

suggestedAnswer.text: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.

comment.text: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.

acceptedAnswer.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

comment.text: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.

answerExplanation.text: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

hasPart.name: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from:

about.name: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from:

hasPart.assesses: When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from: | When making a right turn from a highway with two lanes traveling in your direction, you may turn from: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane closest to the center of the road.

comment.text: The lane closest to the center of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

comment.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

comment.text: Either lane, depending on oncoming traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

comment.text: The lane nearest the curb or edge of the roadway.

answerExplanation.text: Begin and end the turn in the lane nearest the right-hand curb. Do not swing wide into another lane of traffic.
